content.raw:
> we could potentially generate a package off of that

We (read @\_jrivero\_) have released 3rd party packages into ubuntu the past, such as Simbody. I'm not sure how much work that is though, and what's the usual involvement of the library's maintainers.

> bring the entire dep into the ignition-common repo

We've also done this in the past, from large dependencies like ODE, to medium ones like GTest, until header-only ones like Tiny OBJ loader. I'd lean towards starting with that, since it should be the path of least resistance. Remotery is Apache2-licensed, so we should be ok.
